titleStmt.title: Mr Sadler re-examined, or, His disguise discovered. Shewing, the grosse mistakes and most notorious falshoods in his dealing with the Commissioners for Approbation of Publike Preachers in his Inquisitio Anglicana. : Wherein also a brief and true account is given of their righteous proceedings with him and those that come before them. / By one who has been a constant eye and ear-witnesse of all their proceedings, though now in no relation to them.
titleStmt.author: Nye, John, d. 1688.
Nye, Philip, 1596?-1672.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Nathaniel Webb and William Grantham, at the signe of the Bear in Pauls Churchyard.,

notesStmt.note: "This has been wrongly attributed to Philip Nye, but ... [was] written by his son John Nye, in his father's defence."--Halkett and Laing, v. 4, p. 129.
Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library.
